It's true about my taste and it's true about my wealth
 But the sins you have were all caused by yourself
 And you can't find salvation in a book upon the shelf
 
 I never started any wars
 I never slept with any whores
 I don't spread my faith by knocking on any doors
 
 I never ate any apple that hung from any tree
 I shouted out my warnings as plainly as can be
 But in the end it's all the same as they simply blame me
 
 Blame Me.
 MuWaahaa-Haaa
 Blame Me.
 
 Is your daddy the one who beat you with his belt
 Dejected and rejected I know just how you felt
 At least you don't know how brimstone really smelt
 
 Oh how the mighty have such a long way to fall
 How do you apologize when He won't answer your call
 The Prodigal son just isn't the story that I saw.
 
 Don't kid yourself son you know it's all the same
 You're just another piece in His indecipherable game
 And when He's done playing He'll leave you with all the blame
 
 Blame Me.
 MuWaahaa-Haaa
 Blame Me.
 
 I'm not saying that I'm free from any guilt
 But upon my hands no blood was ever spilt
 Upon who's body was His temple really built
 
 When you open your mouth when you're down on your knees
 Think of who's the one whom you're really there to please
 Mass and Communal service that's not for the Jeez
 
 I'm sorry my son, you have my deepest sympathy
 You're just another pawn and it's plain for all to see
 But if it makes any difference you can simply blame me.
 
 Blame Me.
 MuWaahaa-Haaa
 Blame Me.
 
 
 
 
 *rough draft.

 Based on 'Sympathy for the Devil' by the Rolling Stones. 
 
 Also, it is a rough draft kicked out in about 20 mins.
 I've been working on another thus, haven't returned to this in a bit.
 But, there are a couple of cumbersom lines I'm not happy with.
